speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: SCENE I. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Flourish of cornets. Enter the PRINCE OF MOROCCO  and his train; PORTIA, NERISSA, and others attending

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Mislike me not for my complexion,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: The shadow'd livery of the burnish'd sun,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To whom I am a neighbour and near bred.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Bring me the fairest creature northward born,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Where Phoebus' fire scarce thaws the icicles,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: And let us make incision for your love,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To prove whose blood is reddest, his or mine.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: I tell thee, lady, this aspect of mine

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Hath fear'd the valiant: by my love I swear

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: The best-regarded virgins of our clime

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Have loved it too: I would not change this hue,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Except to steal your thoughts, my gentle queen.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: In terms of choice I am not solely led

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: By nice direction of a maiden's eyes;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Besides, the lottery of my destiny

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Bars me the right of voluntary choosing:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: But if my father had not scanted me

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And hedged me by his wit, to yield myself

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: His wife who wins me by that means I told you,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Yourself, renowned prince, then stood as fair

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: As any comer I have look'd on yet

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: For my affection.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Even for that I thank you:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Therefore, I pray you, lead me to the caskets

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To try my fortune. By this scimitar

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: That slew the Sophy and a Persian prince

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: That won three fields of Sultan Solyman,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: I would outstare the sternest eyes that look,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Outbrave the heart most daring on the earth,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Pluck the young sucking cubs from the she-bear,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Yea, mock the lion when he roars for prey,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To win thee, lady. But, alas the while!

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: If Hercules and Lichas play at dice

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Which is the better man, the greater throw

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: May turn by fortune from the weaker hand:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: So is Alcides beaten by his page;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: And so may I, blind fortune leading me,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Miss that which one unworthier may attain,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: And die with grieving.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You must take your chance,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And either not attempt to choose at all

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Or swear before you choose, if you choose wrong

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Never to speak to lady afterward

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: In way of marriage: therefore be advised.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Nor will not. Come, bring me unto my chance.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: First, forward to the temple: after dinner

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Your hazard shall be made.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Good fortune then!

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To make me blest or cursed'st among men.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Cornets, and exeunt
